resources.string: Ready to connect when network quality improves
Checking the quality of your Internet connection…
Connected to device for Internet access.
Allow this paired device to access your messages.
Allow this paired device to access your SIM card.
Enable Bluetooth tethering on the paired device to access the Internet on this device.
Connected for call and media audio
Unable to pair with %1$s. Make sure %2$s is ready to pair.
"Can't connect to %1$s. Check your settings in %2$s and try again."
Device name will appear when this device is connected.
Speed at which the text is spoken.
Set language-specific voice for spoken text.
Play short demonstration of speech synthesis.
Install voice data required for speech synthesis.
This speech synthesis engine may collect all speech, including passwords, credit card numbers, and other personal data. Continue?
A network connection is required to support %s.
Reset the pitch at which text is read out to the default setting.
%1$s: %2$s left until fully charged via AC
%1$s: %2$s left until fully charged via USB
Unable to use Bluetooth tethering while connected to Wi-Fi network.
Swipe contacts and recent calls right to call them or left to message them.
Only show contacts with phone numbers on the CONTACTS tab.
Show my number in outgoing calls according to the default operator settings.
Access the internet through your mobile network.
International roaming charges may apply. You can go to Settings > Connections > Mobile networks > Data roaming to turn on or off data.
Data roaming will be enabled. Using Mobile data while roaming may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Optimise the sound quality of your phone for hearing aids.
Use Wi-Fi to make and receive calls whenever possible.

"This device supports Wi-Fi Calling. This allows you to keep using your phone in places where you don't have cellular coverage - like basements, condos and tall buildings. If you are using Wi-Fi Calling, the usage is deducted from your airtime/messaging buckets in your wireless plan."
Use Wi-Fi networks to make and receive calls anywhere, without connecting to a mobile network.

"To use this function, check that it is offered by your service provider, enable it in Call settings, then connect to a Wi-Fi network.
The icon below will be shown whenever this function is available."
Tap SETTINGS to set up Wi-Fi calling.
Receive and make/send calls and messages via a Wi-Fi network.
Unable to open %s. Only apps added to home screen can be used in Maximum power saving mode.
"I'm busy at the moment. Please text me."
Block calls and messages from specific phone numbers.
Select the categories of calls that will be blocked, or add specific numbers to block both calls and messages from them.
"You won't receive any calls or messages from this number."
From Android Nougat onwards, Call blocking mode is replaced by Block numbers. Instead of just blocking calls, Block numbers will automatically block both calls and messages.
Tap SETTINGS to edit Block numbers.
The numbers you add will appear here.
The messages you add will appear here.
Blocking mode is turned off when making emergency calls.
When you make emergency calls, Blocking mode will be turned off automatically so that you can receive calls from the emergency services.
Show ongoing calls in pop-ups instead of full screen view while using other apps.
Press Home key to answer calls
Press Home key to answer calls
Press Volume up to answer calls
Press Power key to end calls
Press Power key to end calls
Say “Answer” or “Decline” to respond to incoming calls.
You can answer or decline calls by saying %1$s or %2$s. The speakerphone will turn on when you answer a call with a voice command.
"Voice commands aren't available when phone set to Vibrate."
Some numbers already added to list.
All numbers already added to list.
Roaming assistance helps you easily call your home country while you are roaming internationally.
"Automatically apply your home country code when calling contacts you've called before."
Change voice, text, and data roaming settings, including settings for international roaming.
Make/receive voice calls and send/receive text messages while roaming.
Make/receive voice calls and send/receive text messages while roaming internationally.
Connect to data services while roaming.
Connect to data services while roaming internationally. This requires an international roaming plan. Faster data speeds may be available for purchase.
To change setting, go to Settings > Connections > Mobile networks > Roaming > Set roam alerts.
Restart your device to verify the USIM.

"Your phone's Video Calling function won't work when mobile data is off. Also, you won't be able to use the Internet, Email or other apps that need a data connection unless you use "Wi-Fi. Turn off the mobile data connection?
Unless you connect to a Wi-Fi" network, you won't be able to use Internet, Email, or other apps that require a network connection."

If Mobile data is turned off, your device must be connected to a Wi-Fi" network to use services that require a network connection.
Mobile data will be turned off."
To use data roaming, go to Settings > Connections > Global roaming, then enable Data roaming.
Mobile data will be turned on. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Mobile data will be turned on to use GiGA LTE. This may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Mobile data will be turned on. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Data roaming enabled. Note that high data charges may apply depending on your payment plan and location.
Service provider ntwk not available. Emergency calls only.
Show the HD icon on the indicator bar when HD voice call is available.
The Mobile Data setting must be on to use AT&T Video Call. Tap OK to turn on Mobile Data.
Mobile Data and Enhanced LTE Services
The Mobile Data setting and Enhanced LTE Services setting must be on to use AT&T Video Call. Tap OK to turn on these settings.
The International Data setting must be on to use AT&T Video Call. Tap OK to turn on International Data.
The Enhanced LTE Services setting must be on to use AT&T Video Call. Tap OK to turn on Enhanced LTE Services.
The International Data and Enhanced LTE Services settings must be on to use AT&T Video Call. Tap OK to turn on these settings.
"To make video calls - turn on Enhanced LTE Services"
"To make video calls - turn on Mobile Data"
"To make video calls - turn on Enhanced LTE Services - turn on Mobile Data"
"To make video calls - turn on International Mobile Data"
"To make video calls - turn on Enhanced LTE Services - turn on International Mobile Data"
Enable HD Voice and advanced communication services where available.
Enable enhanced communication using LTE data.
Enhance your calls by using 4G data.
Temporarily be able to turn Video calling feature on/off.

Register your USIM card with the China Unicom HD Voice service to use the HD Voice function. Unless your USIM card is registered, the HD Voice function will not be available, even if it is enabled in Settings.
Make HD voice calls on the 4G network.
Enable advanced calling features over the 4G LTE cellular network where available.
Show the latest contact information for each caller.
To use Data roaming and LTE roaming, you must agree to the Terms of Service below.
"Receiving automatic updates for social networks, email, weather, etc. may result in additional charges while you are roaming. Data roaming will not be available if you do not agree."
"LTE networks will be used to send and receive data while you are roaming. LTE roaming will not be available if you do not agree. 3G networks may be used while LTE networks are not available."
If you enable Data roaming, international roaming charges will apply, regardless of your normal data plan.
Receiving automatic updates for social networks, email, weather, etc. may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
I have read and agree to all the Terms of Service above.

Unless you use Wi-Fi", you will no longer be able to use Internet, Email, or other apps that require a data connection.
Mobile data will be turned off."
Mobile data (WCDMA/LTE) will be turned off. Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will no longer be able to use apps that require a data connection. You can still send and receive multimedia messages.
Mobile data (WCDMA/LTE) will be turned off. Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will no longer be able to use apps that require a data connection. Sending or receiving multimedia messages will be restricted.

Unless you use Wi-Fi", you will no longer be able to use Internet, Email, or other apps that require a data connection.
Mobile data will be turned off."

Unless you use Wi-Fi", you will no longer be able to use Internet, Email, or other apps that require a data connection.
Mobile data will be disabled."
Mobile data will be turned on. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Mobile data will be turned on. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Mobile data will be turned on. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Connecting via packet data may incur additional charges. Continue?

"Use 4G networks for Internet calls while roaming. To stop using 4G networks, restart your phone after turning off this function. 4G networks should be turned off when network quality is poor while you're overseas and should always be turned on in Japan."
This setting turns off 2G service. If 2G service is off, some apps and functions may not work in locations where LTE or 3G is unavailable.
Tap OK to call the voice mail centre and play voice mail messages.
Tap OK to call the voice mail centre and record your message for callers.
The ring time has been set.
"Call notifications: Enabled Notifications will be received about all missed calls."
"Call notifications: Enabled Notifications will only be received about missed calls from people who have allowed their caller IDs to be shown."
Call notifications has been enabled. Notifications will be received about all missed calls.
Call notifications has been enabled. Notifications will only be received about missed calls from people who have allowed their caller IDs to be shown.
Call forwarding service has been enabled.
Call forwarding service has been disabled.
Voice mail service (for when forwarding number is busy): Enabled
Voice mail service (for when forwarding number is busy): Disabled
Settings registered for Call forwarding service.
Select whether to change the call forwarding number only, or to change the number and enable Call forwarding service.
Select whether or not to use Voice mail service while the call forwarding number is busy.
To enable Call forwarding service, enter a number to forward calls to and how long your device will ring before calls are forwarded.
Voice mail service has been enabled.
Voice mail service has been disabled.
Select whether to enable Call guidance.
Guidance and relevant information will be provided in Japanese, both for you, when you make calls, and also for people who call you.
Guidance and relevant information will be provided in Japanese for you, when you make calls, and in Japanese then English for people who call you.
Guidance and relevant information will be provided in Japanese for you, when you make calls, and in English then Japanese for people who call you.
Guidance and relevant information will be provided in English for you, when you make calls, and in Japanese for people who call you.
Guidance and relevant information will be provided in English for you, when you make calls, and in Japanese then English for people who call you.
Guidance and relevant information will be provided in English for you, when you make calls, and in English then Japanese for people who call you.
You have not subscribed to the Call waiting service.
Caller ID display request service has been enabled.
Caller ID display request service has been disabled.
You have not subscribed to the Remote operation service.
Public mode (power off) has been enabled.
Public mode (power off) has been disabled.
Select whether to deregister all numbers from Nuisance call blocking service or only the last number registered.
The maximum number of phone numbers that can be registered to Nuisance call blocking service has been reached. Tap OK to deregister the oldest number and register the number you entered.
Calls from the number you entered will be blocked.
Calls from the number of the last incoming call will be blocked.
The oldest number registered to Nuisance call blocking service has been deregistered.
All numbers have been deregistered from Nuisance call blocking service.
The last number registered to Nuisance call blocking service has been deregistered.
Restrict incoming calls will be enabled. Incoming calls will be restricted while you are roaming.
Restrict incoming calls will be disabled. No calls will be blocked while you are roaming.
Restrict incoming calls has been enabled. All incoming calls will be blocked while you are roaming.
"Restrict incoming calls: Not enabled Invalid password entered."
Restrict incoming video calls/64K data has been enabled.
Restrict incoming calls has been disabled. No calls will be blocked while you are roaming.

"Restrict incoming calls: Not disabled.
Invalid password entered."
Restrict incoming calls: Enabled for all calls
"Restrict incoming calls: Failed to perform action Try again later."
Restrict incoming calls: Enabled for incoming video calls/64K data while roaming
Incoming notifications while roaming has been enabled.
Incoming notifications while roaming has been disabled.
Caller ID display request will be enabled.
Voice mail service will be enabled.
Voice mail service will be disabled.
Tap OK to call Voice mail service and play voice mail messages.
Tap OK to change the Voice mail service settings.
The ring time will be set.
Tap OK to change the Call forwarding service settings.

When the screen is off and the phone is turned face down, incoming calls will be shown on the Edge lighting panel. Decline an incoming call and send a preset message to the caller by placing your finger on the heart rate sensor for 2 seconds.
No text has been entered. Tap OK to use the default quick reply.

"Use Smart Call to identify spam and scam callers.
This service shows you the names and profile pictures of callers and message senders who aren't in your contacts."
This service is not available in other countries.
Tap here to protect yourself from spam callers for free.
Tap here to identify spam and scam callers.
Register your name and number with the server so recipients without your number might see when you call/send messages to them.

"“%1$s” is a feature that is designed to identify numbers that are not stored in your Contact List and alert you when an incoming call may be a nuisance call or spam. In order to provide this feature, certain data, for example the caller’s phone number, will be collected directly from your device by %2$s and the data will be governed by the %2$s %3$s and %4$s."

"No matter what choice you make here, you are free to disable this feature at any time by adjusting your preferences in the “Settings” menu. Please click the appropriate button below to indicate that you agree with the above and would like to enable the %s feature at this time."

This service is available when your mobile device is connected to your mobile network during incoming or outgoing calls, but will be limited while roaming. Using mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your data plan with your network provider.
Find phone numbers and information for local businesses and venues nearby.
This service requires your location information.
To optimise the accuracy of your location information, go to Settings > Connections > Location > Locating method, then select High accuracy.
To optimise the accuracy of your location information, go to Settings > Connections > Location > Locating method, then select High accuracy.
Using mobile networks instead of Wi-Fi networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
When you stop using %1$s, the service will be deactivated, and all of your %2$s data stored by the service provider will be deleted.
Receive notifications after calls are recorded.
Record calls to or from selected numbers automatically.
LTE networks will be used for mobile data.
3G networks will be used for mobile data. LTE network customers can select LTE for faster network connections.
Wi-Fi Calling lets you call and text while on a Wi-Fi Network. Usage will be deducted from the minute and text message buckets in your Wireless plan. Click below to Activate.
Please connect to a Wi-Fi network to register for Wi-Fi Calling.
Click here to register for Wi-Fi Calling or to update your existing Emergency Address.
Wi-Fi Calling is a service that allows you to make and receive calls and texts via a Wi-Fi connection. The usage is deducted from your airtime/messaging buckets in your wireless plan.

"This allows you to keep using your phone in places where you don't have cellular coverage - like basements, condos and tall buildings. Also, if you are using Wi-Fi Calling while roaming, all of your incoming calls and outgoing calls and messages to Canadian numbers are deducted from your airtime and messaging buckets included in your wireless plan."
"The icon below will appear at the top of your device's screen when your device is ready to use Wi-Fi Calling."
1. On the device home page, press the “Phone” icon
3. Click the registration link and follow the setup process
Call and text over Wi-Fi. If Wi-Fi is not available, call and text over the cellular network. (Recommended to avoid dropped calls)
Call and text over the cellular network. If cellular is not available, call and text over Wi-Fi.
To add emergency contacts, go to the Contacts app > More options button > Groups > ICE - emergency contacts, then tap EDIT.

"Wi-Fi calling is an Orange service that enables you to make and receive calls through a Wi-Fi connection, even if there is no mobile network coverage. This allows calling where it was impossible before like basements, ground floors or inside large buildings.
To use Wi-Fi calling, first connect to a Wi-Fi network, and then activate the service in Settings > Wi-Fi calling.
The first time that you activate the service, Orange will send you a confirmation message the moment the service is available.
Wi-Fi calls will be charged based on your tariff plan.
Whenever this feature is available, you will see the Wi-Fi calling icon in the upper part of the screen."

"If you select Wi-Fi network preferred, Wi-Fi network will be used to establish calls by default. In case you are not connected to any Wi-Fi network or Wi-Fi strength is weak, mobile network will be used to establish calls.
If you select mobile network preferred, mobile network will be used to establish calls by default. In case there is no or weak mobile coverage, Wi-Fi network will be used instead."
Use Wi-Fi networks to make and receive calls anywhere in metropolitan France, without connecting to a mobile network.

WiFi Calling is the service providing the ability to make and receive voice calls over the Internet connection in any available WiFi network, even if you are out of mobile coverage. The WiFi Calling icon on the notification bar (shown below) indicates that all your calls are using WiFi Calling.

"In a case the WiFi connection is getting weak or you get out of the WiFi coverage your mobile phone would switch to mobile network.
Using WiFi Calling is rated according to the service rates provided by your mobile operator. Details on www.orange.pl/wificalling
Please note that calls to Emergency Numbers eg.112 will be routed through a mobille network. In case there is no mobile coverage the Emergency Calls could be routed via WiFi Calling service. In such cases your mobile operator may not be able to determine your exact location information and therefore would route your call to the Emergency Centre which is not the closest one for your actual location."

WiFi Calling lets you make and receive voice calls over any WiFi network available, even if you are out of mobile coverage. The WiFi Calling icon on the notification bar indicates that all your calls are using WiFi Calling.

"More information about the service provided by your mobile operator could be found at www.orange.pl/wificalling
Choose the SETTINGS menu below to activate your WiFi Calling service on your mobile device."
Your location information might be sent to your service provider while you are using Wi-Fi calling. Contact your service provider for details.
Your location-related information can be sent to Google and your operator in order to establish Wi-Fi calls, whether you have activated or not the location feature.
When you see VoWiFi icon in your notification bar you can call using any WiFi network around the world at the local price of your data plan! More information here.

The Claro VoWiFi service has been activated. When the service icon appears on the status bar, it means you can make calls using any Wi-Fi network, inside or outside of the country, for the same price as your Claro plan! Tap here for more information.
Wi-Fi" Calling is a service of your mobile operator, Orange Polska S.A. Please read the description of the service provided by your operator:"

Wi-Fi Calling service enables you to make and receive voice calls over any Wi-Fi internet connection, even in a situation where you are outside any mobile network’s coverage. Once the service is active for your mobile number, every time you connect to a Wi-Fi network, your voice calls will be performed using Wi-Fi Calling. This will be indicated to you by a dedicated icon on the notification bar.

If your Wi-Fi connection is of poor quality or your device is outside a Wi-Fi" network’s coverage, your phone will make calls using an available mobile network.
Calls you make with "Wi-Fi Calling in Poland are charged in the same way as your regular mobile calls in your mobile tariff plan. Incoming calls in Poland are free of charge. If you make Wi-Fi" Calling calls outside Poland your calls may be charged a price specified in your mobile tariff plan’s price list.
Notwithstanding, your "Wi-Fi connections may be charged independently by the provider of your Wi-Fi connection.

Once you press the [I ACCEPT] button and your phone connects to a Wi-Fi network, your Wi-Fi Calling service will be activated. You can disable Wi-Fi" Calling at any time using the phone menu.
Detailed information about your "Wi-Fi" Calling service can be found at www.orange.pl/wificalling.
Please note that in order to enable your emergency calls (e.g., such as 112 calls) to be routed to the closest emergency centre suitable for your actual location, your emergency calls made while the "Wi-Fi Calling service is enabled will be carried by your device through any mobile network available at a given moment. Only in cases where no mobile network is available will an emergency call be routed via the Wi-Fi Calling service. Unfortunately, in such cases we will not know your precise location and therefore your emergency call may not be routed to the emergency centre closest to your actual location.

In regard to your use of Wi-Fi Calling, we – as your personal data controller – will process your data based on the number and model of the device on which you use Wi-Fi Calling, the software used on the device, the endpoint of the network used to connect with Wi-Fi Calling (including the IP address and the country to which this IP address is attributed), and the time and duration of each call, in order to perform and settle the service, answer any complaints, and to perform any statutory obligations. We will process this data for the duration of the agreement on providing telecommunication services between you and us, and after its termination – for the period of recovery of claims and of performing other tasks defined in the provisions of law. Providing the data is voluntary, but it is necessary to use the service. You have the right to access and to rectify your data.

Please find our data: Orange Polska S.A., address: Aleje Jerozolimskie 160, 02-326 Warsaw, Poland, registered in the Register of the Entrepreneurs of District Court for the Capital City of Warsaw in Warsaw, XII Commercial Division of the National Court Register (KRS), under entry number 0000010681, NIP (tax ID) 526-02-50-995; with share capital (fully paid up) of PLN 3,937,072,437.00.
Video unavailable for this call. Call connected as a voice call.
Number you are calling cannot receive video calls at this time. Call connected as a voice call.

"%s is trying to upgrade to video call with you.
To do Video Calling, turn ON Mobile Data or Video Calling in settings after the call."
Purchase roaming packages to use mobile networks while roaming internationally.
S Roaming is not installed. Tap INSTALL to install it.
"While Mobile data is turned off, you won't be able to use Internet, Email, or other apps that require a network connection, unless you connect to a "Wi-Fi network.
"If mobile data is off, you won't be able to use the internet, email or other apps that need a data connection unless you use Wi-Fi."
AT&T Video Call won’t work if mobile data is off. Also, you won’t be able to use the internet, email or other apps that need a data connection unless you use Wi-Fi.
"If international data is off, you won't be able to use the internet, email or other apps that need a data connection when roaming outside of the U.S., Puerto Rico and USVI unless you use Wi-Fi."

"AT&T Video Call won't work if international data is off when roaming outside of the U.S., Puerto Rico and USVI. Also, you won’t be able to use the internet, email or other apps that need a data connection unless you use Wi-Fi."
"Your mobile data connection is turned off. Unless you use Wi-Fi, you won't be able to use the Internet, Email or other apps that require a data connection."

"Your mobile data connection is turned off. Your phone's Video Calling function won't work when mobile data is off. Also, you won't be able to use the Internet, Email or other apps that need a data connection unless you use Wi-Fi."

"Please call Verizon at (888) 294-6804 to learn how you can activate this device on another wireless carrier's network.
Enter the code you get from Verizon:"
Tap here to use your phone on a different network.
The latest version is already installed.
"Can't check for updates. Your phone isn't connected to a network."
Unable to check for updates. There is no network connection.
